title: Body mass index and clinical outcomes in breast cancer patients undergoing endocrine therapy: A meta-analysis and Mendelian randomization study.
abstract: The relationship between breast cancer prognosis, Body Mass Index (BMI), and endocrine therapy outcomes remains inconclusive. This study examines BMI's impact on survival outcomes in breast cancer patients receiving endocrine therapy through Mendelian randomization (MR) and a comprehensive clinical data review.
